name.title: Process Name
name.description: A unique identifier for your process. Used in URLs and API calls.

version.title: Version
version.description: Semantic version of your process definition. Increment when making changes.

description.title: Description
description.description: Human-readable description of what this process does. Shown in the process list.
description.example: Automates content review with AI analysis and human approval

triggers.title: Triggers
triggers.description: Define how this process can be started. Processes can have multiple triggers.

triggers.type.title: Trigger Type
triggers.type.description: How the process is started: 'manual' (user-initiated), 'webhook' (HTTP POST), or 'schedule' (cron).

triggers.id.title: Trigger ID
triggers.id.description: Unique identifier for this trigger within the process.

triggers.schedule.title: Schedule (Cron)
triggers.schedule.description: Cron expression for scheduled triggers. Format: minute hour day-of-month month day-of-week.

steps.title: Steps
steps.description: The sequence of tasks that make up your workflow. Steps can run sequentially or in parallel.

steps.id.title: Step ID
steps.id.description: Unique identifier for this step. Referenced by depends_on and variable interpolation.

steps.name.title: Step Name
steps.name.description: Human-readable name shown in the execution timeline.

steps.type.title: Step Type
steps.type.description: The type of step determines what action is performed.

steps.agent.title: Agent
steps.agent.description: The agent (by name or ID) that will execute this task. Must be a running agent.

steps.message.title: Message/Prompt
steps.message.description: The instruction sent to the agent. Supports variable interpolation with {{...}} syntax.

steps.depends_on.title: Dependencies
steps.depends_on.description: List of step IDs that must complete before this step runs. Creates sequential/parallel flow.

steps.timeout.title: Timeout
steps.timeout.description: Maximum time this step can run. Format: number + unit (s, m, h). Step fails if exceeded.

steps.output_key.title: Output Key
steps.output_key.description: Name for storing this step's output. Access later with {{steps.step_id.output.key}}.

steps.title.title: Approval Title
steps.title.description: Title shown in the approval dialog for human_approval steps.

steps.description.title: Approval Description
steps.description.description: Detailed description shown to approvers. Supports variable interpolation.

steps.assignees.title: Assignees
steps.assignees.description: List of users who can approve this step. If empty, any user can approve.

steps.gateway_type.title: Gateway Type
steps.gateway_type.description: How routing decisions are made: 'exclusive' (first match), 'parallel' (all routes).

steps.routes.title: Gateway Routes
steps.routes.description: Conditional routing rules for gateway steps. Each route has a condition and target.

steps.routes.condition.title: Route Condition
steps.routes.condition.description: Expression that determines if this route is taken. Uses {{...}} variable syntax.

steps.routes.target.title: Route Target
steps.routes.target.description: Step ID to execute if this route's condition is true.

steps.default_route.title: Default Route
steps.default_route.description: Step ID to execute if no route conditions match.

steps.delay.title: Timer Delay
steps.delay.description: How long to wait for timer steps. Format: number + unit (s, m, h, d).

steps.process_id.title: Sub-Process ID
steps.process_id.description: The ID of another process to execute as a sub-process.

steps.recipients.title: Recipients
steps.recipients.description: List of recipients for the notification. Format depends on channel type.

outputs.title: Outputs
outputs.description: Define process outputs that can be accessed after completion.

outputs.value.title: Output Value
outputs.value.description: Expression to compute the output value. Uses {{...}} variable syntax.

default.title: YAML Process Definition
default.description: Define automated workflows using YAML. Processes orchestrate AI agents through steps with dependencies, conditions, and approvals.
